channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Fed Chair Powell indicates interest rate cuts ahead: 'The time has come for policy to adjust'
item.description: Powell laid the groundwork for interest rate cuts ahead, though he declined to provide exact indications on timing or extent.

item.title: Body of final person missing from sunken superyacht found off Sicily
item.description: Divers on Friday retrieved the body of the final missing person who was on a superyacht that sank off the coast of Northern Italy.

item.title: Bank of England's Bailey: 'More restrictive policy' could still be needed due to labor market shocks
item.description: Bailey will say he currently places more weight on "the degree of restriction we have in place today easing off over time."

item.title: Nestle CEO departure seen as 'not such a bad thing' for investors, analyst says
item.description: Nestle has replaced its CEO Mark Schneider with company veteran Laurent Freixe in a bid to shake up its fortunes.

item.title: Japan's yen has seen wild swings this year — is it still a safe-haven asset?
item.description: Throughout most of 2024, the yen has seen weakness levels not seen since 1986, BOJ interventions, and a rapid strengthening after the BOJ raised rates.

item.title: No longer a financial reservoir? Saudi Arabia’s spending confirms clear shift in strategy
item.description: The kingdom's $925 billion sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund, saw its assets jump 29% in 2023 — and domestic investment was a major driver.

item.title: Europe's wineries battle to survive as extreme heat hurts production
item.description: Extreme weather is threatening production at southern Europe's wineries, with one fine wine grape variety at risk of extinction.

item.title: New, deadlier mpox found in Thailand: These Asian nations have ramped up precautions
item.description: More cases of the dangerous strain has been identified outside the African continent.

item.title: Corporate loyalty does not pay off, HR expert says, as job hopping gains currency among young people
item.description: Just 23% of workers aged 42 and under expressed strong interest in staying with their companies long-term, according to a study by WorkProud.

item.title: Can a robot give a decent massage? We tested one at a luxury hotel in New York City
item.description: Lotte New York Palace is the first hotel to partner with Aescape, a New York-based robotics company that developed an AI-powered robot that gives back massages.

item.title: Here's everything to expect from Fed Chair Powell's speech Friday in Jackson Hole
item.description: For all the attention being paid to the speech, the chances of it containing any new news seem remote.

item.title: A recession is coming in the U.S., and 'a few rate cuts' won't prevent it, says strategist
item.description: Contrary to what many believe, investment research firm BCA Research sees that the economy is on the cusp of a recession.

item.title: Baidu reports slower growth in robotaxi rides
item.description: Chinese tech company Baidu is reporting slower growth in its Apollo Go robotaxi rides than in prior quarters.

item.title: Asia markets mostly lower ahead of Powell's speech at Jackson Hole; Australia snaps 10-day win streak
item.description: While it is not exactly clear what Powell will say, he has previously used the speech to outline broad policy initiatives and to provide policy clues

item.title: World’s second-largest diamond discovered in Botswana
item.description: One of the largest diamonds ever to be excavated was found in Botswana at a mine owned by Canadian firm Lucara Diamond.

item.title: Harris accepts Democratic nomination, vows to be a 'common sense' president who 'unites us'
item.description: Kamala Harris is set to face Donald Trump in November's election. Her candidacy was set in motion when President Joe Biden withdrew his reelection bid.

item.title: FDA approves updated Pfizer, Moderna Covid vaccines as virus surges; shots to be available within days
item.description: The Covid jabs target a strain called KP.2, a descendant of the highly contagious omicron subvariant JN.1 that began circulating widely in the U.S. this year.

item.title: China's self-driving startup WeRide delays U.S. IPO as deadline looms
item.description: WeRide was expected to offer 6.5 million ADS (American depositary shares) in the range of $15.50 to $18.50.

item.title: Harris says Trump 'wants to be an autocrat' and tyrants are 'rooting' for him
item.description: Leon Panetta, Rep. Elissa Slotkin and Sen. Mark Kelly castigated Republican nominee Donald Trump as a threat to American values and national security.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The search for a stock market alternative
item.description: Indian bonds attract foreign investors as Wall Street forecasts lackluster future growth in stock prices.

item.title: China's state media slams U.S. over Biden nuclear strategy report
item.description: The outspoken editor of the Global Times, a Beijing government mouthpiece, seized on a New York Times report to accuse Washington of hypocrisy.

item.title: Trump could cash out his DJT stock within weeks. Here's what happens if he sells
item.description: Trump Media made its debut on the Nasdaq under the ticker DJT in late March, following a lengthy merger with a special purpose acquisition company.

item.title: Hong Kong IPOs signal rebound as HKEX remains 'cautiously optimistic,' says CEO
item.description: Fundraising activity is rebounding on HKEX, reinforced by additional follow-on fundraising and a strong IPO pipeline, according to CEO Bonnie Chan.

item.title: Peloton shares soar 35% as turnaround plan takes hold, losses shrink
item.description: Peloton has been working to generate free cash flow and return to profitability, and has made cuts to sales and marketing budgets to improve its balance sheet.

item.title: These are the 10 best 'workcation' cities in the world for hybrid workers
item.description: Budapest topped the list as the best destination for a 'workcation' in 2024, according to a study by the International Workplace Group.

item.title: This was the schedule of speakers on the final night of the DNC
item.description: Among the speakers: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper and GOP former Rep. Adam Kinzinger. The Chicks and Pink performed.

item.title: 'The World' is a luxury ship that travels the world full time — here's how much an apartment on it costs
item.description: A resident explains the pros and cons of living on "The World" — a luxury ship with privately owned apartments.

item.title: Former FTX exec Ryan Salame's romantic partner indicted on campaign finance crimes
item.description: Michelle Bond was charged two months before her romantic partner, former FTX exec Ryan Salame, is due to surrender to being a prison sentence.

item.title: Perplexity AI plans to start running ads in fourth quarter as AI-assisted search gains popularity
item.description: Following months of controversy surrounding plagiarism allegations, Perplexity AI is about to start selling ads alongside AI-assisted search results.

item.title: Zoom stock has best day in almost 2 years on quarterly results, increased guidance
item.description: Zoom shares jumped on Thursday after the company reported better-than-expected results for the second quarter and lifted its full-year guidance.
